alert.note: Alert for East Polk; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cherokee, southeastern Polk and southeastern Monroe Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ducktown, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murphy, Ducktown, William L. Davenport Refuge, Violet, Big Frog Mountain, Hot House, Turtletown, Copperhill, Hiawasse Dam and Archville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Polk; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
